title: NetEffectContribution for ComparativeEvidence: Bypass surgery effects on Remission of diabetes in JAMA 2018 Norwegian cohort study

variableDefinition.description: Cohort study with baseline data of exposures from November 2005 through July 2010 and follow-up data from 2006 until death or through December 2015 at a tertiary care outpatient center, Vestfold Hospital Trust, Norway. Consecutive treatment-seeking adult patients (n = 2109) with severe obesity assessed (221 patients excluded and 1888 patients included).

observed.display: StudyGroup: Severely Obese Adults 2018 Norwegian Cohort

variableDefinition.description: bariatric surgery vs. specialized medical treatment without bariatric surgery

intended.display: GroupAssignment: Bariatric Surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

valueReference.display: Outcome Importance Rating of DichotomousIntendedOutcome: Remission of diabetes  for StudyEligibilityCriteria: Eligibility Criteria for Bariatric Surgery Randomized Trial (Diabetes Surgery Study)

citeAs: NetEffectContribution for ComparativeEvidence: Bypass surgery effects on Remission of diabetes in JAMA 2018 Norwegian cohort study [Database Entry: FHIR Evidence Resource].
